alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:27PM CDT until May 06 at 8:59AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Fall River at Fredonia affecting Wilson County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Fall River at Fredonia. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flood waters backup into residential yards located 1 mile south of Fredonia near the gage site off of Highway 96. Expect bank overflows on both banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:01 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.1 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.9 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Fall River Fredonia 17.0 18.1 Thu 8 pm CDT 6.5 6.2 6.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
